meanings.definition: Scraiched (verb): past tense of scraich, to make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The cat scraiched loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: Yesterday, the birds scraiched in the early morning.
meanings.sent3: The scraiched alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: Her scraiched laughter echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The scraiched brakes of the car startled the pedestrians.

meanings.definition: Scraiched (adjective): having made a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The scraiched cat ran away from the loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The scraiched birds flew off in a panic.
meanings.sent3: She covered her ears to block out the scraiched sirens.
meanings.sent4: The scraiched microphone screeched during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The scraiched violin strings produced an unpleasant sound.

meanings.sent1: The scraiched of the train whistle filled the station.
meanings.sent2: The scraiched of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent3: The scraiched of the brakes made him jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The scraiched of the microphone feedback interrupted the speech.
meanings.sent5: The scraiched of the thunder shook the windows.
